refnamediv.refpurpose: Load data in the USGS dem format into a WDB database.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: demLoad loads the contents of the given files files into the wdb database.
The database must be up and running for this program to work, unless one of the options --help or --version have been given on the command line.

listitem.para: Produces the help message and then exits.
Produce version information and then exits.
Read additional configuration from the given file.
Set output logfile. The default is to print to stdout
Sets the logging level, from 1 (most) to 5 (least)
Specify the database name to connect to (e.g., wdb).
Specify the database host to connect to (e.g., somehost.met.no).
Specify the WDB user to connect as. The database user must have access to the wdb_grib role (this is will usually be the case if the gribLoad process is being run by the creator of the database).
Specify the database port to connect to (e.g., 5432).
This lists the contents of the file, instead of inserting the data into the database
If the database location table doeas not contain any entries for the given location, insert a place definition automatically
Use the given name as dataprovider name in the database. This may fail if the user does not have sufficient authorization in the database
Store data into database using the given reference time, instead of infinite future.

refsect1.title: Exit Status
refsect1.para: demLoad returns 0 to the shell if it finished normally and 1 if a fatal error occured during loading (out of memory, files not found, database not found, etc.). Note that not being able to load a field is not considered a fatal error; in such cases, demLoad simply logs a warning or error to the log and tries to load the next piece of data.
